message: The next morning, I carry Granny to the neighborhood hospital.
I made sure to ask Mr. Haga for the day off, just in case.
We call it a hospital, but this is the Old Residential District. It's an old, cramped facility, understaffed and overcrowded.
The building is falling apart, and not even the kindest of descriptions would include the word 'sanitary.' Still, everyone there is kind.
They've known Granny for a long time. They told us to come right in when I called.
Granny hates going to the hospital, always insisting she can take care of herself, but today, she behaves and lets them examine her.
Maybe she's in more pain than she lets on.
They tell us she's alright to recover at home, so I carry her back after the examination is over.

When I put Granny to bed and sit down to take a break, she yells at me to 'get to work already.'

I want to stay and look after her, but she's not having any of it.
I call Mr. Haga, who tells me I can come in now and leave early, so I give up and head for work.
I'm standing behind my desk, worrying about Granny, when the message arrives.
It's from Koujaku.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Mizuki..."
If Koujaku felt the need to message me about it, Mizuki must've really been acting strange.
Maybe Mizuki's been pushing himself too hard.
I head to the bathroom to call Mizuki.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Hey. Mizuki?"

name: ミズキ
message: "...Aoba? What's up?"
At the sound of his voice, I feel a wash of relief.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Nothing, really. Just wanted to say hi."

name: ミズキ
message: "What's with you, man? We just saw each other yesterday. You're acting weird."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Umm, well, I guess I was just wondering if you were doing okay."

name: ミズキ
message: "'Course I am. Why?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "I dunno. Guess maybe you seemed a little down yesterday, is all."

name: ミズキ
message: "So you called because you were worried about me? Thanks. But I'm fine."

name: 蒼葉
message: "You sure?"

name: ミズキ
message: "Yeah."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Okay. Well, we should talk more later."

name: ミズキ
message: "Sure. Later."
I head back to the counter with a sigh.
Mizuki's voice didn't have its usual energy.
He said he was fine, and I thought it better not to push the subject, but...
First Granny collapses, now I have this to worry about.
Though I hope my concerns are unfounded, they stay with me through the rest of the afternoon.
I barely get any work done.
